body_html:
I'm pretty sure you're going to need to vectorize this to have it run as fast as the old code; I see calls to THVector_(copy) in the old TH implementation, and that's our entrypoint to vectorized code.

You also probably want to call memcpy when no conversion happens, although if you're planning to test for converting/non-converting at the top-level, it's probably not necessary to put it directly in the code here.
body_text:
I'm pretty sure you're going to need to vectorize this to have it run as fast as the old code; I see calls to THVector_(copy) in the old TH implementation, and that's our entrypoint to vectorized code.
You also probably want to call memcpy when no conversion happens, although if you're planning to test for converting/non-converting at the top-level, it's probably not necessary to put it directly in the code here.
body:
I'm pretty sure you're going to need to vectorize this to have it run as fast as the old code; I see calls to `THVector_(copy)` in the old TH implementation, and that's our entrypoint to vectorized code.

You also probably want to call `memcpy` when no conversion happens, although if you're planning to test for converting/non-converting at the top-level, it's probably not necessary to put it directly in the code here.
